attribute.name: alwaysShowContainer
attribute.description: Always show the results container, instead of only showing when the user is requesting them.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: applyLocalFilter
attribute.description: If set to true, the filterResults method will be run on the response from the data source.

attribute.name: autoHighlight
attribute.description: Automatically highlight the first item in the list when the results are made visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->

attribute.name: boundingBox
attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: button
attribute.description: To use a button<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->

attribute.name: contentBox
attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: cssClass
attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.

attribute.name: dataSource
attribute.description: The data source that results will be read from. This can either be an existing DataSource object, or it can be a value that would be passed to DataSource.

attribute.name: dataSourceType
attribute.description: The type of the data source passed into dataSource. This can be used to explicitly declare what kind of DataSource object will be created.

attribute.name: delimChar
attribute.description: The character used to indicate the beginning or ending of a new value. Most commonly used is a ",".<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: destroyed
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: disabled
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: focused
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: forceSelection
attribute.description: If typeAhead is true, this will clear a selection when the overlay closes unless a user explicitly selects an item.

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

attribute.name: hideClass
attribute.description: css class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: <!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: initialized
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: input
attribute.description: The input field which will recieve the users input.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: matchKey
attribute.description: The key or numeric index in the schema to match the result against.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->

attribute.name: maxResultsDisplayed
attribute.description: The maximum number of results to display.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"10"}-->

attribute.name: minQueryLength
attribute.description: The minimum number of characters required to query the data source.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"1"}-->

attribute.name: queryDelay
attribute.description: The amount of time in seconds to delay before submitting the query.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0.2"}-->

attribute.name: queryInterval
attribute.description: When IME usage is detected or interval detection is explicitly enabled, AutoComplete will detect the input value at the given interval and send a query if the value has changed.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0.5"}-->

attribute.name: queryMatchCase
attribute.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match only results with the same case.

attribute.name: queryMatchContains
attribute.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match results which contain the query anywhere in the text, instead of just matching just items that start with the query.

attribute.name: queryQuestionMark
attribute.description: For IO DataSources, AutoComplete will automatically insert a "?" between the server URI and the encoded query string. To prevent this behavior, you can set this value to false. If you need to customize this even further, you can override the generateRequest method.

attribute.name: render
attribute.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: schema
attribute.description: A valid configuration object for any of DataSource schema plugins.

attribute.name: schemaType
attribute.description: A valid type of DataSource schema plugin, such as array, json, xml, etc.

attribute.name: srcNode
attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: strings
attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false}-->

attribute.name: suppressInputUpdate
attribute.description: Whether or not the input field should be updated with selections.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->

attribute.name: typeAhead
attribute.description: If autoHighlight is enabled, whether or not the input field should be automatically updated with the first result as the user types, automatically selecting the portion of the text the user has not typed yet.

attribute.name: typeAheadDelay
attribute.description: If typeAhead is true, number of seconds to delay before updating the input. In order to prevent certain race conditions, this value must always be greater than the queryDelay.

attribute.name: uniqueName
attribute.description: The unique ID of the input element.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: useARIA
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be enabled for the Widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->

attribute.name: visible
attribute.description: Boolean indicating weather or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: alwaysShowContainerChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'alwaysShowContainer' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: applyLocalFilterChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'applyLocalFilter' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: autoHighlightChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'autoHighlight' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: boundingBoxChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'boundingBox' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: buttonChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'button' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: containerCollapse
event.description: Handles the containerCollapse event. Fired when the container is hidden.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: containerExpand
event.description: Handles the containerExpand event. Fired when the container is shown.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: containerPopulate
event.description: Handles the containerPopulate event. Fired when the container is populated.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: contentBoxChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'contentBox' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: cssClassChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'cssClass' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: dataError
event.description: Handles the dataError event. Fired when there is an error accessing the data.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: dataRequest
event.description: Handles the dataRequest event. Fired when ever a query is sent to the data source.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: dataReturn
event.description: Handles the dataReturn event. Fired when data successfully comes back from the data request.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: dataSourceChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'dataSource' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: dataSourceTypeChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'dataSourceType' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: delimCharChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'delimChar' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: destroy
event.description:
Lifecycle event for the destroy phase, fired prior to destruction. Invoking the preventDefault method on the event object provided to subscribers will prevent destruction from proceeding.

Subscribers to the "after" moment of this event, will be notified after destruction is complete (and as a result cannot prevent destruction).

event.name: destroyedChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'destroyed' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: disabledChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'disabled' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: focusedChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'focused' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: forceSelectionChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'forceSelection' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: heightChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'height' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: hideClassChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'hideClass' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: idChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'id' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: init
event.description:
Lifecycle event for the init phase, fired prior to initialization. Invoking the preventDefault() method on the event object provided to subscribers will prevent initialization from occuring.

Subscribers to the "after" momemt of this event, will be notified after initialization of the object is complete (and therefore cannot prevent initialization).

event.name: initializedChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'initialized' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: inputChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'input' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: itemArrowFrom
event.description: Handles the itemArrowFrom event. Fired when the user navigates via the keyboard away from a selected item.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: itemArrowTo
event.description: Handles the itemArrowTo event. Fired when the user navigates via the keyboard to a selected item.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: itemMouseOut
event.description: Handles the itemMouseOut event. Fired when the user mouses away from an item.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: itemMouseOver
event.description: Handles the itemMouseOver event. Fired when the user mouses over an item.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: itemSelect
event.description: Handles the itemSelect event. Fired when an item in the list is selected.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: matchKeyChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'matchKey' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: maxResultsDisplayedChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'maxResultsDisplayed' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: minQueryLengthChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'minQueryLength' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: queryDelayChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'queryDelay' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: queryIntervalChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'queryInterval' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: queryMatchCaseChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'queryMatchCase' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: queryMatchContainsChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'queryMatchContains' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: queryQuestionMarkChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'queryQuestionMark' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: renderChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'render' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: renderedChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'rendered' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: schemaChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'schema' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: schemaTypeChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'schemaType' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: selectionEnforce
event.description: Handles the selectionEnforce event. Fired if forceSelection is enabled and the users input element has been cleared because it did not match one of the results.

event.name: srcNodeChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'srcNode' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: stringsChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'strings' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: suppressInputUpdateChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'suppressInputUpdate' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: tabIndexChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'tabIndex' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: textboxBlur
event.description: Handles the textboxBlur event. Fired when the user leaves the input element.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: textboxChange
event.description: Handles the textboxChange event. Fired when the value in the input element is changed.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: textboxFocus
event.description: Handles the textboxFocus event. Fired when user moves focus to the input element.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: textboxKey
event.description: Handles the textboxKey event. Fired when the input element receives key input.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: typeAhead
event.description: Handles the typeAhead event. Fired when the input element has been pre-filled by the type-ahead feature.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: typeAheadChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'typeAhead' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: typeAheadDelayChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'typeAheadDelay' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: uniqueNameChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'uniqueName' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: unmatchedItemSelect
event.description: Handles the unmatchedItemSelect event. Fired when a user selects something that does not match any of the displayed results.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: useARIAChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'useARIA' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: visibleChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'visible' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: widget:contentUpdate
event.description: Notification event, which widget implementations can fire, when they change the content of the widget. This event has no default behavior and cannot be prevented, so the "on" or "after" moments are effectively equivalent (with on listeners being invoked before after listeners).<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: widget:render
event.description:
Lifecycle event for the render phase, fired prior to rendering the UI for the widget (prior to invoking the widget's renderer method).

Subscribers to the "on" moment of this event, will be notified before the widget is rendered.

Subscribers to the "after" moment of this event, will be notified after rendering is complete.

event.name: widthChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'width' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

attribute.name: activeState
attribute.description: Whether to track the active state of the button.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: boundingBox
attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: classNames
attribute.description: An object map of the CSS class names to use for the different interaction states.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false}-->

attribute.name: contentBox
attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: cssClass
attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.

attribute.name: defaultState
attribute.description: Whether to apply the default interaction state to the button<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->

attribute.name: depth
attribute.description: Number representing the depth of this Widget relative to the root Widget in the object heirarchy.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"-1"}-->

attribute.name: destroyed
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: disabled
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: focused
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: handler
attribute.description: An event callback to handle when a user interacts with the button. This can either be a function that will be attached on click, or an object map that accepts the following keys: {fn: // The function to execute context: // The context to execute the function in type: // The type of event to listen for (defaults to "click") }

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

attribute.name: hideClass
attribute.description: css class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.

attribute.name: hoverState
attribute.description: Whether to track the hover interaction state of the button.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->

attribute.name: icon
attribute.description: The icon to use inside of the button. Possible values are:<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: iconNode
attribute.description: DOM Node to display the icon of the ButtonItem. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside boundingBox which matches aui-button-icon.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: <!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: Number representing the Widget's ordinal position in its parent Widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->

attribute.name: initialized
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Text to use inside of the button.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: labelNode
attribute.description: DOM Node to display the text of the ButtonItem. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside boundingBox which matches aui-button-label.

attribute.name: parent
attribute.description: Retrieves the parent of the Widget in the object hierarchy.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

attribute.name: render
attribute.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.name: root
attribute.description: Returns the root Widget in the object hierarchy. If the ROOT_TYPE property is set, the search for the root Widget will be constrained to parent Widgets of the specified type.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

attribute.name: selected
attribute.description: Number indicating if the Widget is selected. Possible values are: <dl> <dt>0</dt> <dd>(Default) Not selected</dd> <dt>1</dt> <dd>Fully selected</dd> <dt>2</dt> <dd>Partially selected</dd> </dl><!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->

attribute.name: srcNode
attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: strings
attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false}-->

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->

attribute.name: title
attribute.description: Text to use as the title attribute of the button.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Button type.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"button"}-->

attribute.name: useARIA
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be enabled for the Widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->

attribute.name: visible
attribute.description: Boolean indicating weather or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: activeStateChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'activeState' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: boundingBoxChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'boundingBox' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: classNamesChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'classNames' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: depthChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'depth' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: destroy
event.description:
Lifecycle event for the destroy phase, fired prior to destruction. Invoking the preventDefault method on the event object provided to subscribers will prevent destruction from proceeding.

Subscribers to the "after" moment of this event, will be notified after destruction is complete (and as a result cannot prevent destruction).

event.name: destroyedChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'destroyed' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: disabledChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'disabled' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: focusedChange

You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: init
event.description:
Lifecycle event for the init phase, fired prior to initialization. Invoking the preventDefault() method on the event object provided to subscribers will prevent initialization from occuring.

Subscribers to the "after" momemt of this event, will be notified after initialization of the object is complete (and therefore cannot prevent initialization).

event.name: initializedChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'initialized' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: typeChange

event.name: useARIAChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'useARIA' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: visibleChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'visible' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

event.name: widget:contentUpdate
event.description: Notification event, which widget implementations can fire, when they change the content of the widget. This event has no default behavior and cannot be prevented, so the "on" or "after" moments are effectively equivalent (with on listeners being invoked before after listeners).<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

event.name: widget:render
event.description:
Lifecycle event for the render phase, fired prior to rendering the UI for the widget (prior to invoking the widget's renderer method).

Subscribers to the "on" moment of this event, will be notified before the widget is rendered.

Subscribers to the "after" moment of this event, will be notified after rendering is complete.

event.name: widthChange
event.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'width' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.
